main event: On February 9, 1955, in Atlanta, Georgia, a large, round, silver sphere remained stationary for two hours, then appeared to decrease in size and disappear.
interesting points: The UFO sighting lasted for 2 hours, providing a substantial observation period.
The object was initially classified as a balloon of a known type after investigation.

On February 5, 1955, the Air Defense Command intercepted an unidentified fast-moving target at an estimated speed of 4,000 miles per hour at an altitude of 35,000 feet in the vicinity of Atlanta, Georgia.
Ground observers at the radar station were unable to visually confirm the fast-moving target.
The object was tracked on radar for approximately 2 minutes before disappearing from the radar scope.
